title: 2025 Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Venezuelan Leader María Corina Machado
snippets: Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado has won this year's Nobel Peace Prize for her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela.
The Norwegian Nobel Committee said Machado's work promoting democratic rights is "one of the most extraordinary examples of civilian courage in Latin America in recent times.
The Nobel Committee announced Venezuela's opposition leader Maria Corina Machado as this year’s Nobel Peace Prize winner
Nobel Committee says win is 'for her struggle to achieve a just and peaceful transition from dictatorship to democracy'.
The opposition politician 'keeps the flame of democracy burning amidst a growing darkness', the Nobel Committee says.
The Nobel Peace Prize for 2025 has gone to Maria Corina Machado. The committee lauded "her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela." Follow DW for more.
The 2025 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Maria Corina Machado.
Win dashes hopes of Donald Trump after US president repeatedly claimed he should be awarded prize

The Nobel Prize committee recognized María Corina Machado, Venezuelan opposition leader in hiding, for keeping “the flame of democracy burning amid a growing darkness.”
Ms. Machado built one of Venezuela’s most important political movements, and lives in hiding from President Nicolás Maduro’s authoritarian government.

summary: The 2025 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado for her efforts in promoting democratic rights in Venezuela. The Norwegian Nobel Committee praised her as an exemplar of civilian courage in Latin America, highlighting her work towards a peaceful transition from dictatorship to democracy. Machado, who is currently in hiding from President Nicolás Maduro's government, has been recognized for keeping the flame of democracy alive in Venezuela. title: Loyola Chicago's Chaplain Sister Jean Passes at 106
snippets: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the longtime chaplain of the Loyola-Chicago men's basketball team, died Thursday at the age of 106. "[She] was an invaluable source of wisdom and grace for generations of students, faculty, and staff," the school said.
Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt gained national attention during the men's team run to the 2018 Final Four
Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt Dies At Age 106, Spent 31 Years as Loyola Chicago Chaplain Bleacher Report
Sister Jean, Beloved Loyola Men’s Basketball Team Chaplain, Dies at 106 Sports Illustrated

Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the chaplain for the men’s basketball team at Loyola Chicago who became a beloved international celebrity during the school’s fairy-tale run to the Final Four of the NCAA Tournament in 2018, has died, the university announced Thursday night.
titles: Sister Jean, beloved Loyola-Chicago chaplain, dies
Sister Jean dies at 106: Legendary Loyola basketball chaplain and March Madness icon passes away

summary: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the beloved chaplain of Loyola Chicago's men's basketball team, passed away at 106. Known for her inspirational role during the team's 2018 Final Four run, she served 31 years, touching many lives at the university.

title: Judge Halts Trump's Plan to Deploy National Guard in Illinois
snippets: Federal judge blocks deployment for two weeks, says sending Guard troops would 'add fuel to the fire'.

A US federal judge has issued a temporary restraining order blocking Trump from sending National Guard soldiers to Illinois as part of a sweeping crime and immigration clampdown. The order will last until October 23.
Judge rules against Trump's federalization of National Guard in Chicago Axios
Officials in Oregon and Illinois had challenged the Trump administration’s push to dispatch the National Guard in both states.
The judge called the Department of Homeland Security’s assessment of protests in the Chicago area “unreliable.”
titles: US judge blocks Trump’s deployment of National Guard in state of Illinois
US: Judge temporarily blocks Trump's National Guard deployment in Illinois
Judge rules against Trump's federalization of National Guard in Chicago - Axios
Judge blocks Trump from deploying troops in Illinois for now
Judge Blocks Trump’s Chicago National Guard Deployment For Two Weeks
summary: A US federal judge has issued a temporary restraining order preventing President Trump from deploying National Guard soldiers to Illinois, aimed at addressing crime and immigration issues. This decision, effective until October 23, came after legal challenges in multiple states against the Trump administration's efforts to use troops in Democratic-led cities. The judge criticized the Department of Homeland Security's assessment of protests in Chicago as "unreliable."

title: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Strained by Gaza Attack; Hostage Deal Progresses
snippets: Al-Ahli Hospital tells Al Jazeera seven bodies recovered after Israeli attack helicopters swoop east of Gaza City.
Explosions and smoke were seen in Gaza on Friday, with attacks taking place after Israel’s gov't approved the ceasefire.
Thousands of Palestinians begin streaming back to their homes as Israeli troops complete partial withdrawal
The statement came after Israel approved a deal between Israel and Hamas to pave the way for the release of hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners.
Israel and the militant group Hamas agreed to the first phase of a deal involving an exchange of Israeli hostages in Gaza and Palestinian detainees.

summary: After Israeli attack helicopters targeted areas east of Gaza City, Al-Ahli Hospital reported seven fatalities. This incident occurred despite Israel's government approving a ceasefire and happened alongside visible explosions in Gaza. Following these events, Israeli troops initiated a partial withdrawal, prompting thousands of Palestinians to return home. Concurrently, Israel and Hamas reached an agreement on a deal's first phase, aiming to exchange Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners, signaling a move towards de-escalation.

title: Peru Impeaches President Boluarte, José Jerí Sworn in as Interim Leader
snippets: The ousting of President Dina Boluarte follows a string of scandals and growing outrage over crime in Peru.

Congress in Peru voted to remove President Dina Boluarte, who has been criticized for her failure to address the rising crime rate. A Congress leader was sworn in as interim president until the April 2026 elections.

Congress leader José Jerí sworn in as interim president as majority of lawmakers initiate impeachment against Boluarte Lawmakers in Peru have voted to remove the president, Dina Boluarte, whose term has been marked by protests and accusations of failing to stem crime. Boluarte refused to appear befo
Growing outrage over crime and political scandals eroded support for President Dina Boluarte, the country’s most unpopular leader in recent history.
titles: Peru's president removed from office amid soaring crime
Peru lawmakers remove president, successor vows war on crime
Peru lawmakers vote to oust president Dina Boluarte over crime crisis
Peru Ousts President Amid Crime Surge
summary: Peruvian lawmakers voted to impeach President Dina Boluarte, marking a significant political change in a country facing violence and instability. This decision, supported by almost all legislative factions, follows Boluarte's criticized handling of rising crime rates. José Jerí, a Congress leader, was sworn in as interim president until the April 2026 elections, succeeding Boluarte who faced protests and accusations during her term.

title: 7.4-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Southern Philippines, Killing Two
snippets: Philippine president Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said authorities were assessing the situation on the ground and search and rescue efforts were being prepared The southern Philippines was rocked by a powerful 7.6-magnitude earthquake that struck in the region of Mindanao on Friday, initially triggering a t
The quake, centered off the coast of Mindanao, struck at 9:43 a.m. local time but the extent of the damage was not immediately clear.
The 7.4-magnitude quake struck off the eastern coast of Mindanao island on Friday morning. A tsunami warning was issued, but it was later canceled.

A 7.4-magnitude earthquake Friday morning off the southern Philippines killed at least two people, damaged a hospital and schools, knocked out power and prompted evacuations of coastal areas nearby due to a tsunami warning, which was later lifted.
titles: Philippines rocked by damaging 7.6-magnitude earthquake
Powerful 7.4-magnitude earthquake rocks southern Philippines
Three Dead After Powerful Earthquake Strikes Southern Philippines
Powerful earthquake off southern Philippines kills 2 people, causes damages and tsunami evacuations
summary: A 7.4-magnitude earthquake hit off the coast of Mindanao in the southern Philippines on Friday morning, killing at least two people and causing damage to infrastructure including a hospital and schools. The quake, initially reported as 7.6, led to power outages and evacuations due to a tsunami warning that was subsequently lifted. Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. stated that search and rescue efforts were being prepared as authorities assessed the damage.

This agreement marks a significant step towards resolving the two-year conflict, with the ceasefire now in effect.

title: Komeito Exit Leaves Japan's LDP Short of Majority, Stalls PM Appointment
snippets: LDP leader calls coalition collapse 'extremely regrettable', party faces 37-seat shortfall of a parliamentary majority.

Japanese junior coalition party Komeito has quit the government over a funding scandal. The split has thrown doubt on the expected appointment of Sanae Takaichi as Japan's first female prime minister.
Komeito Chief Representative said that the LDP "failed to provide sufficient answers regarding political funding issues."
titles: Takaichi’s bid as Japan’s 1st female PM in doubt as ruling coalition splits
Japan coalition collapse casts doubt on first female PM bid
Takaichi’s bid for Japan’s premiership jolted as Komeito quits ruling coalition, NHK reports
summary: The Komeito party left Japan's coalition government due to a funding scandal, causing the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) to fall 37 seats short of a parliamentary majority. This departure has cast uncertainty on Sanae Takaichi's anticipated appointment as Japan's first female prime minister. Komeito's exit is described as "extremely regrettable" by the LDP leader, who has faced criticism for inadequate responses to political funding concerns.

title: Canadian Postal Workers Shift to Rotating Strikes Starting Saturday
snippets: The union representing Canada Post employees says it will switch from a countrywide strike to rotating strikes starting Saturday that will get mail and parcels moving again.

OTTAWA — The union representing Canada Post employees says it will switch from a countrywide strike to rotating strikes starting Saturday morning, in a move that will get mail and parcels moving again. The Canadian Union of Postal Workers says rotating strikes will begin at 6 a.m. local time. Its an
titles: Canada Post union switching from countrywide to rotating strikes starting Saturday
Canada Post union switching from countrywide to rotating strikes
summary: The Canadian Union of Postal Workers announced a shift from a countrywide strike to rotating strikes starting Saturday at 6 a.m. local time. This decision aims to resume the movement of mail and parcels.

title: Ontario Measles Outbreak Ends After Nearly a Year, 2,300 Infected
snippets: Ontario's measles outbreak, which sickened more than 2,300 people over the course of nearly a year has been declared over.

A weekly Public Health Ontario epidemiology report says the measles outbreak that began in the province almost a year ago is over. The report says Ontario declared the end of the outbreak on Monday using national guidance that says an outbreak is complete 46 days after the onset of a rash in the las
titles: Ontario declares measles outbreak over after nearly a year of spread
Ontario declares measles outbreak over after more than 2,300 infections
summary: Ontario's measles outbreak, which lasted nearly a year and infected over 2,300 people, has officially ended. Public Health Ontario declared the outbreak over on Monday, following national guidelines that consider an outbreak finished 46 days after the last rash onset.

title: US to Lead Multinational Force in Israel with Egypt, Qatar, Turkey, UAE

The American force will help coordinate the many aspects of the cease-fire deal.

title: Dodgers Beat Phillies 2-1, Advance to NLCS After 11th-Inning Error
snippets: The Dodgers beat the Phillies 2-1 on Thursday to advance to the NLCS. The Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of throwing to first after mishandling a bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning.
Watch as the Los Angeles Dodgers walk off their way to the NLCS after Phillies’ Orion Kerkering can’t make a clean throw to home.

Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of tossing to first after mishandling Andy Pages’ bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning, and the Los Angeles Dodgers beat the Philadelphia Phillies 2-1 Thursday to win their NL Division Series 3-1.
titles: Dodgers advance to NLCS after Kerkering's error
Gotta See It: Dodgers advance to NLCS off Kerkering’s wild throw
Dodgers eliminate Phillies after Kerkering’s wild throw in extras
summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers advanced to the NLCS by defeating the Philadelphia Phillies 2-1 on Thursday. The victory was secured in the 11th inning when Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a critical error, throwing wildly past home plate instead of to first base, following a mishandled bases-loaded comebacker. This allowed the Dodgers to win their NL Division Series 3-1.
